Job Position:&nbsp;Training Officer

	The L&amp;D Officer plays a key role in delivering learning initiatives across the organization, ensuring compliance with training requirements, and providing effective logistical and administrative support for training programmers.

	Prepare and dispatch training invitations to participants of approved programmers.
	Obtain statutory approvals from Industrial Training Fund (ITF) for approved programmers.

	Prepare cost implications for training activities involving travel.
	Process vendor payments for training-related services.
	Upload and process all scheduled training programmers on SharePoint for management approval.
	Record staff training data in the training monitor template.
	Process annual ITF reimbursement filing with the ITF consultant.
	Support the implementation of the company&rsquo;s e-learning strategy.
	Perform any other tasks assigned by the L&amp;D Manager or senior management.


Requirements
Formal Education:


	Degree in Management, Social Sciences, Education, IT, Psychology, Statistics, Business Management, or related fields.


Work Experience:


	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar role.
	Experience in designing and delivering training (e.g. in Health &amp; Safety, IT, Technical, and Management Development).

	Strong facilitation and coaching skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Effective personal and time management.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
	Ability to work under pressure.
	Integrity, teamwork, and proactive problem-solving.


Professional Qualifications:


	Relevant competency certification(s) in Training, HR, or related field (e.g., CIPM, CIPD, SHRM, Learning &amp; Development certifications).

Training Officer Job at Dangote Group




        
    

        
        Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Training Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The L&D Officer plays a key role in delivering learning initiatives across the organization, ensuring compliance with training requirements, and providing effective logistical and administrative support for training programmers.


Key Duties and Responsibilites


	Prepare and dispatch training invitations to participants of approved programmers.
	Obtain statutory approvals from Industrial Training Fund (ITF) for approved programmers.
	Maintain accurate records and filing of all training documents and activities.
	Prepare and submit weekly and monthly training activity reports to the L&D Manager.
	Provide logistical support for effective delivery of approved training programmers.
	Maintain proper attendance and conduct end-of-training assessments for all programmes.
	Prepare cost implications for training activities involving travel.
	Process vendor payments for training-related services.
	Upload and process all scheduled training programmers on SharePoint for management approval.
	Record staff training data in the training monitor template.
	Process annual ITF reimbursement filing with the ITF consultant.
	Support the implementation of the company’s e-learning strategy.
	Perform any other tasks assigned by the L&D Manager or senior management.


Requirements
Formal Education:


	Degree in Management, Social Sciences, Education, IT, Psychology, Statistics, Business Management, or related fields.


Work Experience:


	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar role.
	Experience in designing and delivering training (e.g. in Health & Safety, IT, Technical, and Management Development).


Skills and Behaviours:


	Strong facilitation and coaching skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Effective personal and time management.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
	Ability to work under pressure.
	Integrity, teamwork, and proactive problem-solving.


Professional Qualifications:


	Relevant competency certification(s) in Training, HR, or related field (e.g., CIPM, CIPD, SHRM, Learning & Development certifications).

Solar Installation Engineer Job at Jaza Energy




        
    

        
        Jaza is a solar energy start-up working to power Sub-Saharan Africa. We build solar-powered shops which charge batteries customers use to power their homes. In 2022, we achieved over 1.5 million battery swaps, providing approximately 186,000 people access to clean, affordable energy. We employ women from each community (known as Jaza Stars) to run the service, empowering our team to become leaders, entrepreneurs and drivers of economic growth within their communities. We’ve already successfully entered the Nigerian market, piloted several sites here and will grow to hundreds of locations over the next year. To support this expansion, we’re planning to hire over 200 people over the next 6 months.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Solar Installation Engineer
Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo 

Job role


	The Solar Installation Engineer is the owner of the technical operations involved in the installation and maintenance at various sites.
	This position reports to the Regional Service Engineer and works to ensure that our service locations have commissioning and installation of solar technical equipment completed to the pre-defined standards.


Accountabilities:


	Own the technical installation and maintenance process for our service locations by ensuring 100% compliance with the commissioning process.
	Own and manage all tech activities, equipment and tools used in the commissioning process for new sites.
	Own and audit the work completion per allocated site according to defined standards.


 Responsibilities


	Prepare a predeparture checklist of required items, tools and technical equipment for the commissioning of allocated sites.
	Commission, install and maintain solar technical equipment at allocated sites by ensuring that all set processes according to the commissioning guidelines and documentations are accurately done and completed.
	Ensure proper set up of new sites in the Star App, Dashboard and Dataverse before handing the site over to the regional tech.
	Accurately file, respond to, update, and escalate technical issues in Gitlab.
	Remotely troubleshoot and resolve Hub performance issues pre-golive. Travel to Hubs to resolve issues requiring in-person troubleshooting/repairs, for sites still under Expansion. 
	Ensure availability of working Jaza packs for Go-live by checking charge rate.
	Ensure 100% connectivity at new sites and zero downtimes at all Hubs.
	Keep accurate records of Hub/Shop Equipment and product component inventory during the commissioning phase.
	Test new products and firmware as needed. 
	Work effectively with regional tech, supply chain, and other construction teams, ensuring seamless integration between different parts of the project.
	Document and report milestones reached during this process. 


Qualifications


	Background in Electrical/Electronics or any related field.
	Deep knowledge of PV system design, installation and maintenance.
	Knowledge in electrical installation.
	Good data collection, analytical, reporting and communication skills.
	Ability to commit to high level quality standards.
	Ability to learn new technologies as required in the role.
	Ability to work independently, interact with people of different backgrounds, cultures, languages and to travel frequently to remote locations.

title: Job Openings at Credpal
content:
Credpal is an innovative solution that seeks to combat the ever complex loan approval process that has deterred millions from achieving specific goals over the years. We believe quality of life can be drastically improved if individuals can easily make purchases and pay overtime at their convenience with reduced or no financial pressure, while also increasing their purchasing capabilities.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Junior Internal Auditor

Job Location: Lagos

Purpose Statement
     

            
    




	The Junior Internal Audit & Compliance Officer will support the Internal Audit and Compliance function in ensuring the company complies with internal policies, regulatory requirements, and industry standards.
	The role involves assisting with audit activities, reviewing processes and controls, identifying potential risks, and supporting the implementation of corrective actions.
	The officer will work closely with different departments to promote compliance and continuous improvement across the organization.


Responsibilities


	Assist in carrying out internal audits of operational processes, financial activities, and compliance procedures.
	Support the review and documentation of internal controls, identifying gaps or weaknesses for improvement.
	Participate in the execution of audit plans, schedules, and testing procedures.
	Gather, verify, and analyze audit data and documentation from various departments.
	Assist in preparing audit reports, including observations and recommendations, for management review.
	Follow up on audit findings and support the tracking of corrective actions.
	Stay informed about basic regulatory requirements, company policies, and compliance standards relevant to the business.
	Support the development and updating of compliance policies, procedures, and records.
	Assist in creating awareness of compliance requirements among employees when required.
	Provide support during external audits, regulatory reviews, and inspections, including document preparation.
	Participate in audit-related projects, process improvement initiatives, and risk assessments.
	Uphold ethical standards and promote a culture of compliance within the organization.


Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related field & relevant certifications (e.g., Certified Internal Auditor, Certified Regulatory Compliance Manager) is a plus.
	Minimum 2-3 years of proven experience in internal auditing, compliance, or related fields.
	Strong understanding of regulatory requirements, industry standards, and best practices.
	Proficiency in conducting audits, risk assessments, and control evaluations.
	Excellent analytical skills with the ability to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
	Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, to convey audit findings and recommendations.
	Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy and strong organizational skills.
	Proficiency in using audit software, data analysis tools, and the Microsoft Office suite.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
	High level of integrity and ethical standards.
	Willing to resume immediately.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Product QA Engineer

Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Job Type: Full-Time (Hybrid)
Level: Entry/Junior Level
Department: Product & Engineering

Purpose Statement


	We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Product QA Engineer to join our dynamic skilled Engineering team.
	As the Product QA Engineer you will be responsible for performing manual and automated testing of software products to ensure they meet quality standards.
	This role will work closely with software developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to identify and fix bugs, and to improve the overall quality of the product.


Responsibilities


	Perform manual and automated testing of software products
	API documentation and testing 
	Develop and maintain automated test scripts for flutter applications
	Identify and report bugs
	Work with developers to fix bugs
	Participate in product testing meetings
	Write and manage test plans and test cases
	Create reports of testing activities and results 
	Stay up-to-date on new testing tools and techniques


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field with 1-2 years of experience in manual and automated testing
	Strong understanding of software testing principles and practices
	Experience with a variety of testing tools and techniques
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team


Benefits


	Professional development opportunities.
	A collaborative and inclusive work culture that fosters growth and innovation.
	Opportunity to work with cutting-edge products and technologies.
	Supportive and approachable management team dedicated to your success.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Senior Accountant

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full time

Key Responsibilities
Accounting & Financial Management:


	Maintain accurate financial records for daily sales, expenses, and payroll.


Fraud Prevention & Internal Controls:


	Develop, implement, and monitor internal control systems to prevent fraud, theft, and misappropriation of funds.
	Investigate and report any discrepancies or suspicious activities immediately.
	Enforce segregation of duties and approval processes for financial transactions.


Financial Modeling & Analysis:


	Build and maintain financial models to forecast revenue, expenses, and cash flow.
	Track and analyze KPIs such as cost per order, revenue per kitchen, and gross margin.
	Provide insights and recommendations to improve profitability.


Inventory & Cost Control:


	Monitor inventory levels, track food costs, and reconcile variances.
	Work closely with kitchen operations to reduce wastage and optimize procurement.
	Ensure proper cost allocation for raw materials and packaging.


Compliance & Reporting:


	Ensure compliance with tax regulations and prepare statutory filings.
	Support internal and external audits.
	Maintain accurate documentation for financial and regulatory purposes.
	Also, other duties as assigned by the EMPLOYER.
	Post and reconcile financial transactions in the company’s accounting software.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.
	Manage accounts receivable/payable and reconcile bank statements.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance (F&B, hospitality, or retail industry preferred)
	4–7+ years of progressive accounting experience.
	Strong knowledge of GAAP (or IFRS, as applicable)
	Experience with month-end close and financial reporting.
	Proficiency in accounting systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, NetSuite) and Excel.
	CPA or CPA-eligible preferred.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	High attention to detail and accuracy.
	Ability to manage multiple deadlines.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Strong organizational and time-management abilities.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Benefits


	Competitive salary with performance-based incentives.
	Opportunity for career growth in a dynamic food service environment.
	Supportive team and positive work culture.
	Staff discounts on meals and other company perks.


Click here to apply online
